li.class: menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-depth-1 is-disable-text is-title-megamenu col col6 st-mega-menu-columns-11

p.img: Left-to-Right: Emily Andrade, Rimga Viskanta, Gregg Sonken, Marla Strich, Leslie Schneider.

div.p: The five member Board of Trustees of the Encinitas Union School District is elected by the citizens of the city of Encinitas and the Rancho La Costa area of south Carlsbad. Board members serve four year terms and terms are staggered to allow for continuity during election years. Our Board is responsible for the approval of the scope and focus of the Encinitas Union School District. The Board operates under the authority of the California Constitution, the State Legislature​, California ​Education Code​ and the California State Board of Education. The trustees are responsible for approving the annual budget, adopting policies governing the operation of the Board, acts as an appeals board for student expulsions, inter-district transfers, charter school petitions and selecting the district's superintendent

div.p: UPDATE: All EUSD schools and the District Office will be closed to the public for Spring Break from March 30 – April 10, 2020. Following Spring Break, the District will be closed indefinitely due to the current health situation. Please visit www.eusd.net for the most up-to-date information. REGISTRATION IS ONLINE AT WWW.EUSD.NET For assistance contact Amy León at Amy.Leon@eusd.net or 760-944-4300, ext. 1161

Todas las escuelas del Distrito Escolar de Encinitas y las oficinas del distrito estarán cerradas al público del 30 de marzo al 10 de abril del 2020 debido al receso de primavera. Después del receso de primavera, todo el Distrito Escolar estará cerrado indefinidamente debido a la situación actual de salud. Por favor visite nuestro sitio de internet en www.eusd.net para toda información. SI NECEISITA INSCRIBIR A SU HIJO, visite www.eusd.net Para asistencia contacte a Verónica González en Veronica.Gonzalez@eusd.net 760-944-4300, ext. 1460

div.h1: Welcome to the Encinitas Union School District!

div.a: How to Login at Home - Video
Donate to EEF COVID-19 Support Fund for Families In Need

div.p: Thank you for visiting the Encinitas Union School District (EUSD) web site. Founded in 1883, the EUSD is located in beautiful north coastal San Diego County and serves the communities of Encinitas, Leucadia, Olivenhain and the Rancho La Costa area of south Carlsbad. The district’s enrollment of approximately 5,400 students is housed in nine kindergarten – sixth grade schools and includes a special education pre-school program. The district has a long-standing tradition of high student achievement and is acknowledged for its innovative learning opportunities. All nine schools have been recognized as California Distinguished Schools by the CA Department of Education and four have been named National Blue Ribbon Schools by the U. S. Department of Education. EUSD is proud of our students’ academic achievement, appreciative of our families’ involvement in our schools and grateful for the generous support from the communities that we serve.
frameborder=”0″ allow=”accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture” allowfullscreen>

p.b: EUSD Management is excited for the 2019-2020 school year!

div.p: Welcome to Encinitas Union School District!

It is an honor to serve the students, families, staff, and communities of Encinitas and south Carlsbad in the role of Superintendent. Encinitas has had a long-standing tradition of providing an exemplary educational experience for students. From a strong and committed Board of Trustees, to the unique programming at each school, to the innovation in design thinking and real-world project-based learning, to the emphasis on the whole child, there is much to be proud of in EUSD!

I am excited to support the next chapter in EUSD’s success as we strive to further develop an educational system that is deeply connected to the individual needs and passions of our students and staff. It is essential as we consider the future needs of our community, nation, and world in order to provide our students with a wealth of opportunities and instruction that will allow them success and to make a positive impact.

Working together, we can accomplish so much more. To this end, collaboration and open communication are essential. Please reach out, attend one of our Coffee and Conversations with me, or introduce yourself when I am on campus. Thank you for your support!

Sincerely,
Andrée Grey, Ed.D.
Superintendent
